thread.title: Analyzing Procter & Gamble’s Valuation and Growth Outlook
thread.title_full: Analyzing Procter & Gamble’s Valuation and Growth Outlook - Yahoo Finance

author: Penny Morgan
title: Analyzing Procter & Gamble’s Valuation and Growth Outlook
text:
1Q16 Earnings: What Can You Expect from Procter & Gamble? 
( Continued from Prior Part )
Relative valuations for P&G and its peers Procter & Gamble (PG), or P&G, and Kimberly-Clark (KMB) are trading at higher valuations relative to the S&P 500 Index (IVV) (SPY) (VOO) and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DIA). Procter & Gamble is trading at a PE (price-to-earnings) multiple of 19.5x forward earnings. Kimberly-Clark is trading at 19.4x forward earnings. In comparison, the S&P 500 Index and the Dow Jones Industrial Average are trading at forward PE multiples of 17.0x and 15.6x, respectively. All of the valuations are as of October 13, 2015.

Peer valuation Procter & Gamble’s peers include Colgate-Palmolive (CL) and Estée Lauder (EL). The two companies are trading at PE multiples of 22.7x and 26.2x, respectively. On the other hand, Coty (COTY) is trading at a valuation of 28.2x forward earnings.
To learn more about Coty and P&G, please read Coty Buys 43 Procter & Gamble Brands: What Investors Should Know .
Portfolio revamping After the completion of the merger of its beauty brands with Coty, and after Duracell’s deal with Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B), P&G will have exited 60% of its current brand portfolio. With these exits, P&G will also exit the complexity that these brands create. However, the company will still retain 94% of its profit before tax.
Focus on multimedia and e-commerce At the Barclays Global Consumer Staples conference, G&P’s Chief Financial Officer, Jon Moeller, highlighted that the company is focusing on new technology to improve consumer value. For example, diapers have approached 30% growth annually in the e-commerce channel. According to Moeller, Pampers’ online share is greater than its offline share in eight out of ten of its top markets. The company also plans to communicate the innovations in products across multiple media sources.
This could help the company strengthen its 1Q16 sales execution with e-commerce. It could also improve valuations.
To learn more about P&G’s updates on growth and transformational moves, please read A Procter & Gamble Investor Update: Growth and Transformational Objectives .
For more industry updates and analysis, please visit Market Realist’s Consumer Products page .
